entry.title: WIN 200$ and a SOLO SHOW! Open Call Fro artists Friday June 14th 2019
entry.content:
Greenpoint Gallery
üìç brooklyn, NY, United States
üé® All Visual Arts
üìÖ deadline
üí∞ unknown fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

WIN 200$ and a SOLO SHOW!

Greenpoint Gallery is now accepting submissions for our
June 14th People's Choice Salon Show!

Friday,June 14th, 2019 from 8pm- 12am.
DEADLINE: Thursday, May 30th, 2019 at 11pm

For this show, we let the people decide, which means everyone who attends votes for the winners! We pass out ballots at the door and guests who attends choose the winners! It is always one of our most well attended nights, boasting record art sales and a large community of fellow artists and art lovers!
Best in Show wins $200 and a solo show! Runner-up winners receive a slot in a group show with other runner-up winners! Submit today-
We have two gallery floors and a stellar lineup of local bands!

All MEDIUMS ARE ACCEPTED!!
Size Limit: 24" x 36" and under
As always....It's FREE to submit work.
Submit jpegs or a link to your website to: greenpointgallery@gmail.com

Though it is free to submit, there is a $5 registration fee per piece for works accepted into the show. Registration fees go directly toward furnishing the cash prize and expenses of the reception.

The show is for one night only. Artists must deliver the work to the Gallery IN PERSON and the work must arrive READY TO HANG. Artists must also come back to pick up any unsold work after the show.

DEADLINE FOR REGISTRATION AND DROP OFF IS THURSDAY, June 13th at 11pm.

We sell works at EVERY SHOW! We have sold hundreds of pieces already this past year. And, as always, we NEVER take a percentage of any works sold in our dedication to support our artistic community.
Curator Shawn James personally reviews each submission and everyone who enters will receive a personal email notifying them if they are accepted or not. Drop off and pick up times will be included in acceptance emails.
Good luck to you all!
Please help us spread the word to all artists you know! Come and GET YOUR ART ON !
Website: www.thegreenpointgallery.com @ Greenpoint Gallery
Facebook: www.facebook.com/events/302426043994914/


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

Size Limit: 24" x 36" and under
As always....It's FREE to submit work.
Submit jpegs or a link to your website to: greenpointgallery@gmail.com

entry.title: 7/31 - Juried Exhibition "SHOW YOUR WORLD"
entry.content:
RE:ARTISTE International Art Organization
üìç New York, NY, United States
üé® All Visual Arts
üìÖ 07/31/2019 deadline
üí∞ $39.00 fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

All entries are accepted. The digital installation is part of our art show: artwork of all participants is projected at the gallery during the entire show.

Twenty Winners will display original work at the ‚ÄúShow Your World‚Äù exhibition in New York City in November 2019 at Gallery MC.

This is more than just a plain exhibition. To promote our artists we host various art & social events to attract a broader audience and your potential buyers. For artists, we organize networking meetups, workshops, consultations. This festival-like art show attracts thousands of visitors - YOUR ART WILL BE SEEN. Show your art and make new connections. Meet new art enthusiasts and sell your art.
Be exhibited in New York City - New York is considered a center of contemporary art life. The world famous art neighborhoods - Chelsea and Soho, Lower East Side and Bushwick, Dumbo and Williamsburg - are located in New York City. The city hosts more than 1500 galleries and hundreds of art shows each year. New York is the place where you can view internationally renowned artworks along with witnessing how modern art emerges. Get the chance to show your world and art to thousands of visitors.

"The artist's job is to be a witness to his time in history." - Robert Rauschenberg

Art is a non-verbal language understood by people speaking different mother tongues. It conveys both historical and social facts, lifestyle, inspiration, and feelings. We‚Äôve been creating a dialogue among artists from various cities and countries.

Our Fifth (!) Annual Art Competition and Juried Exhibition ‚ÄúSHOW YOUR WORLD‚Äù is open to artists of various media around the globe. Artists of all career levels are welcome. Painters, photographers, mixed media artists from more than 40 countries took part in the previous four editions of ‚ÄúShow Your World‚Äù.

EVALUATION: The Jury Panel represented by gallery board members, curators, exhibiting artists, art business professionals is evaluating our 5th International Juried Exhibition ‚ÄúShow Your World‚Äù. Find out more about the Jurors here.

INSPIRATION:

Being traditional or rebellious, figurative or conceptual artist, SHOW YOUR WORLD, views, ideas:

Show YOUR World ‚Äì happy or sad, active or laid back, open or intimate
Show what only artists can depict ‚Äì feelings, emotions, or relationships
Show wildlife, nature, or urban landscapes
Show what‚Äôs close to your heart or what destroys your comfort
Show your inspiration ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a person, a place, a book, or another work of art
Show your childhood or your future
Show the world you love, hate, or dream about

SUBMISSIONS: Entries must be in JPEG format, no larger than 1400 x 1800 pixels, and under 2MB.

The following disciplines are accepted:

Painting
Drawing/Illustration
Photography
Mixed Media and 3-D Art including Ceramics and Textile
Digital Art/ Video Art
Installation
Performance
PLEASE include your show statement ‚Äì it will help the jurors and curators understand your work better.

DEADLINE: JULY 31, 2019

EXHIBITION: As soon as your entry is submitted you receive a popup web page confirming your submission. The finalists will be announced on the RE:ARTISTE website by October 1, 2019 and will be personally notified via email.

COPYRIGHT: The submitting artists own the copyright to their competition entries as their author(s). By submitting an entry to the art competition the artist gives RE:ARTISTE permission for the entry to be used on the RE:ARTISTE website and its social media channels. The artist gives RE:ARTISTE the right to use his/her name and city of residence for the sole purpose of identifying the artist as the author of the entry. The entry fee is not refundable.


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

Entries must be in JPEG format, no larger than 1400 x 1800 pixels, and under 2MB.

The following disciplines are accepted:

Painting
Drawing/Illustration
Photography
Mixed Media and 3-D Art including Ceramics and Textile
Digital Art/ Video Art
Installation
Performance
PLEASE include your show statement ‚Äì it will help the jurors and curators understand your work better.

For more info please email at info@reartiste.com

entry.title: 7/12 - Call for Proposals: Take A Seat Exhibition
entry.content:
ArtsWestchester
üìç White Plains, NY, United States
üé® All Visual Arts
üìÖ 07/12/2019 deadline
üí∞ unknown fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

"TAKE A SEAT": An exhibition that explores the form, function, creativity, and tradition of seating.

ArtsWestchester invites artists and artist collectives to submit originally designed and handcrafted chairs, alternative forms of seating, or artwork that represents or incorporates chairs for its exhibition, ‚ÄúTAKE A SEAT‚Äù.

Selected work will be on view in ArtsWestchester‚Äôs ‚ÄúTAKE A SEAT‚Äù exhibition, which will open with a reception on September 28, 2019, and be on view to the public through October 19, 2019.

BACKGROUND: "TAKE A SEAT" explores the forms, functions, traditions, and creative frameworks of seating. For the exhibition, ArtsWestchester will consider work in all media including, but not limited to: sculptural, conceptual, functional (and dysfunctional) seating, 2-dimensional artworks, and installations using chairs/seating.
As with all exhibitions at ArtsWestchester's Gallery, "Take a Seat" will be free to the public. The exhibition will address an audience of all ages and backgrounds.

ELIGIBILITY:
Applicants must be at least 18 years old, and must live, maintain a studio or be enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program in New York State.


DEADLINE FOR SUBMISSIONS: July 12, 2019 11:59pm
Artists will be notified of their submission status on or around July 31, 2019.

EXHIBITION PERIOD:
‚ÄúTAKE A SEAT‚Äù will open with a reception on Saturday, September 28, and be on view through October 19, 2019.
ArtsWestchester Gallery hours are Tuesday - Friday, 12-5PM, and Saturday, 12-6PM.


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS:
All Submissions must be submitted digitally via Submittable. E-mailed or mailed submissions will not be considered. Artists must submit a separate statement for each piece.
Complete applications must include:
Artist Bio and/or CV (word document)
High Resolution Images of each work (artists may submit up to 5 unique works, with no more than 3 images per work.) (jpeg, tiff, pdf)
Submission checklist (word document). Checklist should include the following information: title, date, materials, dimensions, sale price, insurance pricem and installation/display details.
Artist Statement for each submitted work (word document)

*Note: ArtsWestchester reserves the right to use any High Resolution Images of selected works for promotional purposes of the exhibition.

Further Questions: Contact Amy Kurlander, Curator: Akurlander@ArtsWestchester.org

entry.title: 7/10 - Haverstraw Riverwide Arts and Music Festival Projex: 6 ‚Ä¢ Juried
entry.content:
Haverstraw Riverwide Arts & Music Festival
üìç Haverstraw, NY, United States
üé® All Disciplines
üìÖ 07/10/2019 deadline
üí∞ unknown fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

$400 Honorarium per accepted submission

JURIED BY: Kathleen Rickling, Director of Public Arts Programs and former Curator at ArtsWestchester, White Plains, NY. Research assistant at Museum of Modern Art, NYC

ADELANTE, THE FUTURE: Water-Front-Parklets ‚Ä¢ Pop-up Art Event

Haverstraw Riverwide Arts & Music Festival is excited to announce a Call for Entry, to its HAVERSTRAW RIVERWIDE ART PROJEX: 6, Pop-Up Parklets. The theme is: Adelante, the Future. To be held in Emeline Park, located on the shore of the Hudson River in the Village of Haverstraw, September 14th, 2019.

In an experimental spirit, we welcome artists interested in moving from the traditional studio, gallery and museum space into the freedom of an outdoor landscape setting with site specific and community accessible art, by making a themed-seating-parklet or vignette, sited on the water front of the Hudson.

PARKLETS: traditionally started by taking a lowly parking spot, encouraging their transformation into parks, playgrounds, pop-up caf√©s ‚Äì anything other than their intended use. We are redefining the concept by asking artists to create a small themed seating vignette within our park.

The Parklets should be an interactive art seating project assembled on-site with a mission to reference any aspect of the ‚Äúcultural landscape‚Äù of this vibrant river town, celebrating the strength of melding its diverse cultural heritage, while it moves future forward over time.

The PARKLET may take form, in any media that can withstand the weather, and site conditions for one day. Re-cyclables are encouraged but not required. Immersive mixed media parklet installations of seating with sculpture, painting, mixed media, tactical and site performance, temporal installations, video, sound projections, or multimedia digital platforms are acceptable.

The festival will include live music, food, craft venders along with NYC, South Street Sea Port's Schooner, Pioneer.

Requests for proposals. Full description: http://www.haverstrawriverwidearts.org
Up to 4 individual artists or adtist team will be accepted.
$400 Honorarium per accepted submission.


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

SUBMISSION DEADLINE: July 10, 2019
WINNER ANNOUNCED: July 22, 2019
DATE OF HAVERSTRAW RIVERARTS PROJEX: 6 September 14, 2019

HONORARIUM: $400 for individual artists or artists teams per selected submission

ELIGIBILITY: Professional visual, sculptors, painters, video, sound projections, multimedia and digital artists, architects, designers and performance artists, are invited to apply.

Required: A digital folder with:

1. A 300 word or fewer proposal that includes the media and scale.
2. Resume
3. Up to 8 images of recent work. (Digital specifications can be found on http://www.haverstrawriverwidearts.org)
4. An image script, which should include title, medium, dimension, and date.

NOTE: Please size your images no larger than 2000 pixels max H or W, at a resolution of 72 dpi and format them as RGB JPGs. You may send up to 8 images. Describe your images in your proposal. Digital images should be in a folder and clearly labeled so that they match the description using two digits (01, 02, 03, etc.) and your name in the following format: LastName_FirstName_01.jpg. Do not submit CDS. All images must be uploaded digitally.

For additional questions about the application, or for specifics of Haverstraw Riverwide Arts & Music Festival Call for Entry, please contact us at: www.haverstrawriverwidearts.org ‚Ä¢haverstrawriverarts@gmail.com ‚Ä¢(845) 708-5098.
